title: Sake-Based Shio Tare
steps: Combine the water, kombu, and mirin in a sealed container.
Place in the fridge and rest at least 6 hours or up to 2 days.
When ready, heat the contents to 71°C/160°F and steep for 10 minutes.
Add the sake, and bring to a boil, cooking for 10 minutes, or until the smell of alcohol subsides.
Add the salt and MSG, whisking to dissolve.
Allow tare to cool before use.
notes: For some additional complexity, this tare uses kombu for flavor, as well as a few other sources of subtle aromatics.
Sake contains trace amounts of glutamate, adding to the umami profile, as well as a variety of other aromatics as a result of the brewing process.
Add 30 mL of tare per 300 mL soup.
